faqs.question: What is the Quick Access Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Quick Access Panel is your primary control center for Avatar Toolkit, providing essential tools and information at a glance. It consists of several main sections:

### Armature Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/quickaccess/armatureselection.JPG[/image]
Select and validate your armature from the dropdown menu. The panel shows validation status and bone count for the selected armature.

### Enhanced Validation Display
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/quickaccess/validationdisplay.JPG[/image]
Detailed validation information with collapsible sections:
- Found Bones: Lists detected bones in your armature
- Non-Standard Bones: Highlights bones that don't follow naming conventions
- Hierarchy Issues: Shows parent-child relationship problems
- Scale Issues: Identifies scale-related problems

### T-Pose Validation
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/quickaccess/tpose.JPG[/image]
Verify if your avatar is in a proper T-pose:
- Validate T-Pose button
- Detailed feedback on arm and leg positioning
- Visual indicators for correct/incorrect positioning

### Pose Controls
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/quick-access/QuickAccess2.png[/image]
Manage pose-related operations:
- Start/Stop Pose Mode
- Apply Pose as Rest Position
- Create Pose Shape Keys

### Import/Export
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/quick-access/QuickAccess3.png[/image]
Quick access to import and export functions:
- Import avatars (supports multiple formats) [View supported formats](https://avatartoolkit.xyz/wiki.html?version=0.1.2#what-file-formats-are-supported-by-the-avatar-toolkit)
- Export menu with multiple format options

[note]The Quick Access Panel adapts its display based on your selected armature's validation status, validation mode settings, and current Blender mode (Object or Pose mode). Different validation modes (Strict, Basic, None) will show different warning levels.[/note]

history.changes: Added documentation for enhanced validation display, T-pose validation, and validation mode warnings
Updated import section to reflect multiple format support and added link to formats documentation
Initial documentation of Quick Access Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Optimization Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Optimization Panel provides essential tools for optimizing your avatar's materials and meshes. Let's explore each section:

### Materials Optimization
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface1.png[/image]
The Materials section contains:
- **Combine Materials**: Efficiently merges similar materials to reduce draw calls

### Mesh Cleanup
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface2.png[/image]
Tools for mesh optimization:
- **Remove Doubles**: Quick vertex merging with default settings
- **Advanced Remove Doubles**: Opens settings panel for precise vertex merging control

### Join Meshes
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface3.png[/image]
Mesh combination tools:
- **Join All Meshes**: Combines all avatar meshes into one
- **Join Selected Meshes**: Merges only selected mesh objects

[note]All optimization tools require a valid armature to be selected in the Quick Access Panel.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Optimization Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Tools Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Tools Panel offers a comprehensive set of utilities for avatar customization and optimization. Here's a breakdown of each section:

### General Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface4.png[/image]
Basic utilities:
- **Convert to Resonite**: Export your avatar in Resonite-compatible format

### Separation Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface5.png[/image]
Mesh separation utilities:
- **Separate by Materials**: Split mesh based on material assignments
- **Separate Loose Parts**: Split disconnected mesh components

### Bone Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface6.png[/image]
Armature manipulation:
- **Create Digitigrade**: Convert standard legs to digitigrade setup
- **Weight Tools**: Clean up weight painting and bone constraints
- **Merge Twist Bones**: Option to combine twist bone weights

### Standardization Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/standardize.jpg[/image]
Armature standardization:
- **Standardize Armature**: Convert non-standard armatures to follow standard naming conventions

### Merge Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface7.png[/image]
Bone merging options:
- **Merge to Active**: Combine selected bones into active bone
- **Merge to Parent**: Merge bones with their parents
- **Connect Bones**: Create connections between bones

### Additional Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface8.png[/image]
Extra utilities:
- **Apply Transforms**: Apply object transformations
- **Clean Shape Keys**: Remove unused shape keys

### Rigify Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/rigify.jpg[/image]
Rigify conversion utilities:
- **Convert Rigify to Unity**: Transform Rigify rigs into Unity-compatible armatures
- **Merge Twist Bones**: Option to combine twist bones during conversion

[note]Many tools require a valid armature selection and specific Blender modes (Edit, Pose, or Object mode).[/note]

history.changes: Added documentation for Standardization Tools and Rigify Tools sections
Initial documentation of Tools Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Custom Avatar Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Custom Avatar Panel provides tools for creating and merging custom avatars. It consists of two main modes:

### Armature Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/custom/custom1.png[/image]
Tools for merging armatures:
- Merge All Bones: Combines all bones from both armatures
- Apply Transforms: Applies all transformations before merging
- Join Meshes: Combines meshes after merging
- Remove Zero Weights: Cleans up weight groups
- Cleanup Shape Keys: Optimizes shape keys during merge

### Mesh Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/custom/custom2.png[/image]
Tools for attaching meshes to armatures:
- Select Target Armature
- Choose Mesh to Attach
- Select Target Bone

[note]All operations require a valid armature selection to function properly.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Custom Avatar Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Visemes Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Visemes Panel provides tools for creating and previewing visemes (mouth shapes) for your avatar. Here's what each section offers:

### Mesh Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes1.png[/image]
Select the target mesh from your armature:
- Dropdown menu showing all meshes in current armature
- Automatically filters meshes with shape keys

### Shape Key Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes2.png[/image]
Select the required shape keys for viseme creation:
- Mouth A Shape Key
- Mouth O Shape Key
- Mouth CH Shape Key
- Shape Intensity Slider

### Preview Controls
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes3.png[/image]
Preview your viseme setup (requires Object Mode):
- Start/Stop Preview
- Preview Selection Dropdown
- Live Preview Updates

### Creation Tools
Generate viseme shape keys with one click:
- Create Visemes Button

[note]Preview mode is only available in Object Mode. The panel requires an active mesh with shape keys to function.[/note]

history.changes: Added mesh selection dropdown and Object Mode requirement for viseme creation
Initial documentation of Visemes Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Eye Tracking Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Eye Tracking Panel provides comprehensive tools for setting up and testing eye tracking on your avatar. It supports both SDK2 and AV3 setups:

### SDK Version Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking1.png[/image]
Choose between:
- SDK2: Full eye tracking setup with blinking
- AV3: Basic eye tracking bone setup

### SDK2 Creation Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eye-tracking/eyetracking2.png[/image]
Complete setup options:
- Bone Setup (Head, Left Eye, Right Eye)
- Mesh Selection
- Shape Key Configuration (Wink, Lowerlid)
- Advanced Options (Blinking, Movement, Distance)

### SDK2 Testing Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking3.png[/image]
Comprehensive testing tools:
- Eye Rotation Controls (X/Y axis)
- Distance Adjustment
- Blink Testing
- Lowerlid Movement Testing

### AV3 Setup
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking4.png[/image]
Simplified bone setup:
- Head Bone Selection
- Eye Bone Selection
- Quick Setup Button

[note]All eye tracking features require a valid armature with properly named bones.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Eye Tracking Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Settings Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Settings Panel allows you to customize Avatar Toolkit's behavior and preferences:

### Language Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/language.jpg[/image]
Choose your preferred interface language from the available options.

### Validation Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/validation.jpg[/image]
Configure armature validation rules:
- Strict Mode: Enforces full hierarchy checking and symmetry validation
- Basic Mode: Only checks for essential bones (hips, spine, chest, neck, head)
- None: Disables validation checks

### Bone Highlighting Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/highlighting.jpg[/image]
Control bone visualization options:
- Enable/disable highlighting of problem bones
- When enabled, you can use the 'Highlight Problem Bones' button to visualize issues
- When disabled, you can clear existing highlighting with the 'Clear Bone Highlighting' button

### Debug Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/0.2.0/debug.jpg[/image]
Developer options:
- Enable Logging: Toggle detailed operation logs for troubleshooting

[note]Some settings changes may require a Blender restart to take effect. The validation mode setting is particularly important when working with non-standard armatures.[/note]

history.changes: Added bone highlighting settings and updated validation mode descriptions
Initial documentation of Settings Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Updater Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Updater Panel helps you keep Avatar Toolkit up to date:

### Update Check
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/updater/updater1.png[/image]
Check for and install new versions:
- Check for Updates button
- Update to Latest Version option

### Version Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/updater/updater2.png[/image]
Manage versions:
- Select specific versions
- View current version
- Install selected version

[info]Avatar Toolkit automatically checks for updates daily when enabled.[/info]

[note]Blender restart is required after updates to apply changes.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Updater Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Texture Atlas Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Texture Atlas Panel provides tools for combining multiple textures into a single atlas texture, optimizing your avatar's performance:

### Material Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/atlas/selector.JPG[/image]
Select materials to include in the atlas:
- Reload/Load Material List button
- Material selection checkboxes
- Expand/Collapse material details
- Search filter for large material lists

### Material Configuration
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/atlas/matconfig.JPG[/image]
Configure texture maps for each material:
- Albedo (Diffuse) texture
- Normal map
- Emission map
- Ambient Occlusion map
- Height map
- Roughness map

### Atlas Creation
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/atlas/atlasbutton.JPG[/image]
Generate the texture atlas with one click:
- Atlas Materials button

[note]The Texture Atlas Panel requires a valid armature to be selected and materials with textures to function properly.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Texture Atlas Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the UV Tools Panel?
faqs.answer:
The UV Tools Panel is available in the UV Editor and provides specialized tools for UV manipulation:

### UV Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/0.2.0/uvtools/uvtools.JPG[/image]
Specialized UV editing tools:
- **Align UV Edges to Target**: Aligns selected UV edges to a target edge for precise UV mapping

[note]The UV Tools Panel is only available in the UV Editor's sidebar under the 'Avatar Toolkit' tab.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of UV Tools Panel interface
